ibis.ipl.impl

Class SendPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.ipl.impl.Manageable
      • ibis.ipl.impl.SendPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ibis.ipl.Manageable, ibis.ipl.SendPort

    public abstract class SendPort
extends Manageable
implements ibis.ipl.SendPort
    Implementation of the SendPort interface, to be extended by specific Ibis implementations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SendPort

        protected SendPort(Ibis ibis,
                   ibis.ipl.PortType type,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   ibis.ipl.SendPortDisconnectUpcall connectUpcall,
                   java.util.Properties properties)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a SendPort with the specified parameters. Note that all property checks are already performed in the Ibis.createSendPort methods.
        Parameters:
        ibis - the ibis instance.
        type - the port type.
        name - the name of the SendPort.
        connectUpcall - the connection upcall object, or null.
        properties - the port properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • killConnectionsWith

        protected void killConnectionsWith(ibis.ipl.IbisIdentifier id)
        Called in case an Ibis died or left. The connections to it must be removed.
        Parameters:
        id - the IbisIdentifier of the Ibis that left/died.

      • getInfo

        protected SendPortConnectionInfo getInfo(ReceivePortIdentifier id)
        Returns the connection information for the specified receiveport identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the receiveport.
        Returns:
        the connection information, or null if not present.

      • removeInfo

        Removes the connection entry for the specified receiveport identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identification of the receiveport.
        Returns:
        the removed connection.

      • connections

        public SendPortConnectionInfo[] connections()
        Returns an array with entries for each connection.
        Returns:
        the connections.

      • finishMessage

        protected void finishMessage(WriteMessage w,
                             long cnt)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Implements the SendPort side of a message finish. This method is called by the WriteMessage.finish() implementation.
        Parameters:
        w - the write message that calls this method.
        cnt - the number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an IO error occurs.

      • finishMessage

        protected void finishMessage(WriteMessage w,
                             java.io.IOException e)
        Implements the SendPort side of a message finish with exception. This method is called by the WriteMessage.finish(java.io.IOException) implementation.
        Parameters:
        w - the write message that calls this method.
        e - the exception that was passed on to the WriteMessage.finish(java.io.IOException) call.

      • bytesWritten

        protected long bytesWritten()
        Returns the number of bytes written to the current data output stream. This method is called by the WriteMessage implementation.
        Returns:
        number of bytes written

      • gotSendException

        protected void gotSendException(WriteMessage w,
                                java.io.IOException e)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Called when a method from WriteMessage receives an IOException. It calls the implementation-specific handleSendException(ibis.ipl.impl.WriteMessage, java.io.IOException) method and then rethrows the exception unless we are dealing with a multicast port, in which case the exception is saved.
        Parameters:
        w - the write message
        e - the exception received
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when e must be rethrown.

      • lostConnection

        public void lostConnection(ReceivePortIdentifier id,
                           java.lang.Throwable cause)
        This method must be called by an implementation when it detects that a connection to a particular receive port is lost. It takes care of the user upcall if requested, and updates the administration accordingly.
        Parameters:
        id - identifies the receive port.
        cause - the exception that describes the reason for the loss of the connection.

      • initStream

        public void initStream(ibis.io.DataOutputStream dataOut)
        This method (re-)initializes the DataOutputStream, and closes the serialization stream if there was one. This method should be called from the implementation-specific constructor, and from each doConnect(ReceivePortIdentifier, long,boolean) call.
        Parameters:
        dataOut - the DataOutputStream to be used when creating a new serialization stream is created.

      • announceNewMessage

        protected abstract void announceNewMessage()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method must notify the receiveports that a new message is coming, if needed. It must also deal with sequencing, if implemented/required.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when this notification fails.

      • doConnect

        protected abstract SendPortConnectionInfo doConnect(ReceivePortIdentifier receiver,
                                                    long timeout,
                                                    boolean fillTimeout)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method must set up a connection with the specified receive port.
        Parameters:
        receiver - identifies the receive port.
        timeout - the timeout, in milliseconds.
        fillTimeout - whether connections should be retried until the timeout is expired
        Returns:
        the SendPortConnectionInfo associated with the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when the connection fails.

      • sendDisconnectMessage

        protected abstract void sendDisconnectMessage(ReceivePortIdentifier receiver,
                                              SendPortConnectionInfo c)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method must notify the specified receive port that this sendport has disconnected from it.
        Parameters:
        receiver - identifies the receive port.
        c - the connection information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • closePort

        protected abstract void closePort()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method should notify the connected receiveport(s) that this sendport is being closed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown when communication with the receiveport(s) fails for some reason.

      • handleSendException

        protected abstract void handleSendException(WriteMessage w,
                                            java.io.IOException e)
        This method is called when a WriteMessage method receives an IOException. The implementation should try and find out which connection(s) were lost, and call the lostConnection(ReceivePortIdentifier, Throwable) method for each of them.
        Parameters:
        w - the WriteMessage.
        e - the exception that was thrown.
